Hello All:

Has anyone else seen this?

I am working with a colleague using=
 Cantera to replace Chemkin in an 
application (Fortran and C++).  We are u=
sing Python 2.5, numarray 
1.5.2 and Cantera 1.7.0 on Windows XP.  We are u=
sing python for 
testing mechanism and determining calculation sequence.  H=
is python 
script runs to completion on his machines (giving similar answer=
s to 
Chemkin btw).  However on 2 machines I run the script on I get the 
f=
ollowing error:

[CVODES ERROR]  CVode
  At t =3D 0 and h =3D 0.0013093, th=
e corrector convergence test failed 
repeatedly or with |h| =3D hmin.

The =
cantera call that triggers this is Interface::advanceCoverages

What is int=
eresting is that I have built a C++ dll following his 
python script logic =
and can call the function from a test program and 
it runs to completion on=
 my machine.  When my cooleague builds and 
runs this executable at his sit=
e he gets the CVODES Error.

I have the Cantera 1.7 source and the SUNDIALS=
 2.3.0 source and have 
built the libraries with MS VS .NET 2003.  When CVO=
DES builds it 
reports:
c:\.. ..\sundials\src\cvodes\cvodea.c(811) : warnin=
g C4700: local 
variable 'hB' used without having been initialized
This doe=
s look like bugs I've seen in iterative solvers before where 
there was an =
unitialized local variable.
